text: [Music]
name is Matthew Sprague I'm a senior
engineer on the front end infrastructure
team here at flex board life supports
mission is to make global trade easier
when people think about global trade
they're thinking about planes trains
automobiles and ships and that's
certainly a large part of it but there's
actually a very important role for
someone that orchestrates all those
services to work together get a cargo
from China to the US there's sometimes
up to 20 people touching that and so
flex port manages all those interactions
to make sure they go smoothly you know
at any point things can go wrong
Goods can be lost containers can fall
off the boat you can have weather delays
we are able to ingest data for all of
our vessels to about 10,000 ships and
about 150,000 flights and we were able
to determine ahead of time what flights
and ships are gonna be affected and also
which customers we have that are going
to be affected recently there's a giant
typhoon that hit Hong Kong and Hong Kong
is one of the major origin points from
for many shipping routes that we do we
had a number of customers who would be
affected by shipments arriving late and
we go ahead and notify those customers
about the changes to the delivery
schedule our bread and butter is getting
goods where they need to be with you
know whether that's for commercial
purposes but also whether it's for you
know Zastrow relief there's a lot of
people trying to give aid and trying to
deliver goods to all these places but
it's hard to do you know you need the
whole supply chain organized to actually
deliver the relief we coordinated with
relief in eight agencies we provide
freight forwarding services for free to
figure out how to get supplies to these
disaster stricken places as we get
tracking data for these ships we put it
in an AWS RDS cluster but additionally
you know we're pulling information in
from you know multiple other services
you know weather tracking boat tracking
plane tracking and all this comes into
our data warehouse which is running an
AWS red ship when those data updates
come in we really can't afford to be
down or I can't afford to be slow it's
pretty great that we can just kick off
that responsibility to AWS
[Music]
